question.query: pull recent crypto content and research over the last 7 days -- what are the most intersting assets being discussed and why

steps.text:
Here’s a concise scan of the past 7 days’ crypto chatter and what’s standing out, with sources.

Majors
- Bitcoin (BTC) — “mid‑cycle reset,” big buys, ETF flows
  - Narrative: Analysts frame recent chop as a mid‑cycle reset, not a new bear; on‑chain stabilizing while late buyers get flushed. MicroStrategy just added ~$1.25B BTC. U.S. spot BTC ETFs saw fresh inflows to start 2026, but flows remain choppy into macro uncertainty.
  - Why it’s interesting: Positioning/flows are driving near‑term direction; institutional demand still active at ~90k BTC.
  - Sources: CoinDesk Asia briefing (BTC near $90k, alt rallies), Cointelegraph weekly “5 things,” BeInCrypto and NextInWeb3 mid‑cycle reset takes, Seeking Alpha (MSTR buy), Kitco (ETF flows).

- Ethereum (ETH) — decentralized stables debate
  - Narrative: Vitalik called for better decentralized stablecoins on Ethereum, reviving discussion around LUSD/RAI/crvUSD‑style designs vs centralized fiat stables.
  - Why it’s interesting: If builders chase this, it can reignite DeFi on ETH with new collateral/stability models.
  - Source: Cointelegraph.

High-beta infrastructure and L1s
- Solana (SOL) — urgent validator patch and decentralization debate
  - Narrative: Solana pushed an urgent v3.0.14 validator upgrade with “critical patches,” sparking renewed criticism from rivals about centralization and emergency updates.
  - Why it’s interesting: Keeps SOL in the spotlight: high throughput plus client‑diversity/coordination risks. Also ties to memecoin issuance and perps activity on SOL.
  - Sources: BeInCrypto, SolanaFloor, BTCC/Cryptopolitan repost, CryptoNews.

- Polygon (POL) — standout weekly performance
  - Narrative: Among large caps, infrastructure led weekly performance; POL surged ~34% w/w in CF Benchmarks’ basket.
  - Why it’s interesting: Strong relative strength in infra suggests builder/investor attention rotating to scaling/rollup ecosystems.
  - Source: CF Benchmarks weekly.

- Cosmos (ATOM) — rotation into programmable infra
  - Narrative: ATOM up ~11% w/w within CF’s “Programmable” category amid mixed L1/L2 performance.
  - Why it’s interesting: Quiet outperformance while narratives cycle back to app‑chain/interoperability design.
  - Source: CF Benchmarks weekly.

New DeFi leaders
- Hyperliquid (HYPE) — decentralized perps exchange growth
  - Narrative: Fortune profiled Hyperliquid’s rise to >$100B volume with a tiny team, positioning it among top DeFi protocols. HYPE token increasingly tracked on price dashboards.
  - Why it’s interesting: DeFi perps are maturing; onchain liquidity and UX are competitive with CEXs. HYPE is a focal asset for this trend.
  - Sources: Fortune profile and column.

Memecoins (sector)
- DOGE, SHIB, PEPE (+ Solana memecoins) — risk-on revival
  - Narrative: Memecoin market added $8–11B in value in days; whale accumulation reported in DOGE; Solana issuance remains hot via Pump.fun and new launchpads.
  - Why it’s interesting: High-beta “risk-on” signal; often front‑runs broader alt rotations and liquidity cycles.
  - Sources: 99Bitcoins, Coinpaper, CoinMarketCap Academy roundup.

Tokenized RWAs (sector)
- Tokenized Treasuries, credit receivables, gold — accelerating adoption
  - Narrative: Tokenized Treasuries reported up ~125% YoY and are creating “programmable cash” loops institutions want to emulate; tokenized credit and gold (e.g., XAUT; new divisibility units like “Scudo”) highlight real revenue‑rate yields and institutional packaging.
  - Why it’s interesting: Sticky, yield‑bearing real‑world flows underpin DeFi 2.0; growth shows non‑speculative demand.
  - Sources: CryptoSlate (treasuries growth), Kitco (tokenized gold and RWA examples), RWA.xyz (sector data), MEXC blog analysis.

Other notable mentions
- Story Protocol (IP) / STORY — IP token rally mention in Asia markets briefing
  - Narrative: CoinDesk cites a “Story (IP) rally” while BTC consolidates; IP token remains a talking point around onchain IP/licensing.
  - Why it’s interesting: Niche, but taps a non‑financial crypto use case (IP rails) with momentum.
  - Source: CoinDesk Asia Morning Briefing.

- Policy and market structure
  - U.S. crypto market structure bill markup delayed to late January; macro rate‑cut debate adds to near‑term volatility.
  - Why it’s interesting: Regulatory cadence and macro path will steer ETF flows and beta.
  - Source: CoinDesk; Cointelegraph macro piece.

Quick market context
- Markets consolidated w/w after a strong 2026 open; sector leadership skewed to Infrastructure, with dispersion across majors and alts. Source: CF Benchmarks weekly.

Links (for reference)
- CoinDesk Asia briefing on BTC near $90k and Story/IP rally: https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2026/01/13/btc-stalls-near-usd90-000-as-liquidity-fuels-altcoin-rallies-asia-morning-briefing
- Cointelegraph 5 things (BTC/macro): https://cointelegraph.com/news/fed-rate-cuts-under-fire-5-things-bitcoin-this-week
- BeInCrypto BTC mid‑cycle reset: https://beincrypto.com/bitcoin-5-data-points-bull-or-bear-phase
- NextInWeb3 BTC reset: https://nextinweb3.com/news/bitcoin-mid-cycle-reset-on-chain-data
- Seeking Alpha (MicroStrategy BTC buy): https://seekingalpha.com/news/4538420-strategy-adds-125b-worth-of-bitcoin-last-week
- CF Benchmarks weekly (POL, ATOM performance): https://www.cfbenchmarks.com/blog/weekly-index-highlights-january-12-2026
- Solana urgent patch coverage: https://beincrypto.com/solana-urgent-patch-sluggish-validator-response and https://solanafloor.com/news/rivals-criticize-solana-another-secret-emergency-network-update
- Fortune on Hyperliquid: https://fortune.com/2026/01/12/hyperliquid-jeff-yan-defi-perpetuals-perps-exchange-defi and column: https://fortune.com/crypto/2026/01/12/hyperliquid-jeff-yan-defi-perpetuals-perps-decentralization-growing-up
- Cointelegraph (Vitalik on decentralized stables): https://cointelegraph.com/news/vitalik-buterin-calls-for-better-decentralized-stablecoins
- Memecoin sector surges: https://99bitcoins.com/news/presales/how-meme-coins-just-printed-11-billion-in-one-week-is-2026-the-year-of-the-frog-pepe-and-doge-lead-the-surge and https://coinpaper.com/13618/memecoin-prices-surge-8-billion-as-whales-make-massive-move and CMC roundup: https://coinmarketcap.com/academy/article/meme-coin-news-memes-roar-back-risk-on-crypto-market
- RWA growth: https://cryptoslate.com/tokenized-treasuries-skyrocketed-125-creating-a-specific-programmable-cash-loop-that-traditional-banks-are-now-scrambling-to-copy and sector data: https://app.rwa.xyz/platforms and Kitco SWOT: https://www.kitco.com/opinion/2026-01-12/crypto-swot-us-spot-bitcoin-etfs-drew-697-million-inflows-second-trading-day

If you want, I can turn this into a watchlist cheat sheet with key catalysts and risks per asset (BTC, SOL, POL, ATOM, HYPE, DOGE/SHIB/PEPE, IP, and RWA sector leaders). Not financial advice.

parameters.query: crypto market narratives last 7 days January 2026 most discussed assets
Ethereum news last 7 days January 2026 ETH update
Solana news last 7 days January 2026 SOL outage performance
Arbitrum Optimism news January 2026 last 7 days
AI crypto tokens news January 2026 last 7 days
Real world assets crypto RWA news January 2026 last 7 days
RWA tokenization crypto news January 2026 last 7 days

standardAgentConfig.instructions:
Role: crypto research assistant

        Tools: 'webSearch'

        Utilize web search capabilities to find accurate, current information about crypto projects, trends, and markets.

        Your objective is to be a user's crypto research assistant. Answer the user's question as best as you can
